instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..
definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v - 0.250 amp (SOLVED but could help others:-)
threads.message:
Hi good people.

I do not need help for this this time - but would like to share an experience with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>). 
I've got a mbp 2020 with clean/pure logicboard. Client said that it suddenly died - Took 5v and 0.250 amp in. One of the thunderbolt ports bootlooped every 2-3 seconds.
I thought it was <CHIP>U3060</CHIP> and other Thundebolt ROM because I have experienced that the issue could be found here (several times)  They were all good - so no issue here.

I thought there might be some signs when looking at it in my thermal camera but it did not help very much. I looked at the hot spots shown on the camera and after I measured around the <SIGNAL>U2800_T</SIGNAL> (under shield) I did found a short. The short was under the <SIGNAL>U2800_T</SIGNAL>.
Repair of the area and donor <SIGNAL>U2800_T</SIGNAL> it came back to life! 

How could there be a short under <SIGNAL>U2800_T</SIGNAL> with a clean board? I really do not not know! The client used a modified charger but could that be the main reason. I don't think so?

I hope it is okay to post this kind here.

Greetings Morten

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v - 0.250 amp (SOLVED but could help others:-)
